label: Sports
sentence:
Question: Is there an age limit for competing in the Olympics?
Answer: For U.S. Athletes:
There is no age limit to compete in the Olympics.

However, some sports do have age requirements for health and safety reasons. Competition rules of certain international federations cite age limits as follows:
- Bobsled (minimum of 14 years old)
- Boxing (17-32)
- Diving (minimum of 14)
- Equestrian (16 or older)
- Figure skating (15 by July 1 of previous year)
- Gymnastics (must be 16 years old in Olympic year)
- Judo (15 or older), luge (16 or older)
- Soccer (under 23)
- Team handball (over 18)
- Weightlifting (17 or older)
- Wrestling (must be at least 17 on day of Opening Ceremonies).

There are no general restrictions among the International Federations on an "upper" age limit.

label: Computers & Internet
sentence:
Title: what is a firewall and what is  a trojan?
Question: please tell me about computer viruses and prevention stratagies.
Answer: (m)

A firewall is a piece of hardware and/or software which functions in a networked environment to prevent some communications forbidden by the security policy, analogous to the function of firewalls in building construction. 

Trojan: Small malicious programs that are delivered secretly or benignly to your computer as executable files (usually through email, chat lines, FTP, Freeware or Shareware programs, MP3s or even movies)-just like the Trojan Horse, innocent looking on the outside, but containing a nasty surprise hidden inside. It is really two programs-one on your computer ("server") and the other on the cracker's ("client"). This server runs automatically every time the computer is started. A Trojan program gives the cracker complete access to your computer. There are thousands of different Trojan programs.  Trojans need user intervention to install (the file needs to be opened) and do not self-replicate like viruses.

label: Science & Mathematics
sentence:
Question: What is Barmuda Triangle?
Answer: The Bermuda Triangle has a reputation for being an area where ships and airplanes dissappear, often under mysterious circumstances. This reputation came to public awareness in the 1950s and became a household name in the 1970s, mostly due to "The Bermuda Triangle", a bestselling book written by Charles Berlitz.

Various explanations for the apparent high number of dissapperances have been put forward, ranging from the mundane to the hyper-fantastic.

Skeptics contend that this region has a comparable rate of maritime and aerial incidents as any other similar sized region of the ocean. They point out that Lloyd's of London, a world-reknowned insurer of maritime vessels, does not charge a higher insurance premium for ships that regularly traverse the triangle.

Scientific considerations for an increased dissaperance rate take into acount that this region experiences severe tropical storms and is the source of many hurricanes. These storms create an increased danger to both ship and air traffic.

Rougue waves have also been put forward as a possible cause. These rare waves can reach heights of as much as 100 feet (30 meters), easily swamping most ships. Rouge waves, however, would have no effect on air travel.

A third scientific explanation is methane hydrates. Methane deposits on the ocean floor may release bursts of methane gas that reduces the density of the water it permeates. Since ships rely on displacement to stay afloat, a reduction of density in the water would cause a ship to immediately sink. As the methane leaves the water and rises into the air, it would reduce the density of the air as well, thus reducing lift on aircraft, causing them to descend rapidly. In addition, the methane would change the air mixture taken into the engines of the aircraft, causing the engine to stall. While these events have not been witnessed in nature, they have been proven in lab experiments.

More exotic explanations for the Bermuda Triangle include it being an area of magnetic disturbance, temporal (or time) holes, the location of the lost city of Atlantis, or extra-terrestrial abduction.

label: Entertainment & Music
sentence:
Title: Yaoi and Slash - what's the appeal?
Question: I'm a relatively new anime devotee, and I was surprised to find myself particularly enjoying yaoi and slash fics.  However, I haven't been able to really put my finger on why.  Of course, what's not to like about animes, mangas, and fics with lots of hot, steamy sex?  But I mean the yaoi and slash genres in particular.  I know the fandom for these genres is largely young adult women.  Any theories why?
Answer: Yes, several - I'm not sure if any of them is "right", though.

Some friends have suggested to me that it could be something similar to straight males liking lesbian porn - you get to read or write about two characters you like going at it without any women, who a large proportion of the fandom will not be attracted to, involved to get in the way. However, that still wouldn't explain why I like it, since I'm more attracted to other women than I am to men.

It could partly be the novelty of it - male/male sex and relationships are things that a woman cannot experience in real life so fanfiction could be a good way to explore these things if you're curious about them but don't want to do anything drastic.

In fandom for some animes/mangas/etc. it could also be partly due to the lack of interesting female characters; if the women aren't interesting in canon you're not going to find them interesting when you read about them in a fic, no matter what they're doing with each other or with the male characters.

A male/male relationship could also seem more equal, and with a same-sex relationship a woman might feel like there was more freedom for the characters not to behave in the way they would be expected to if they were in a relationship with a female (if that makes sense). In a straight relationship there are roles which each person is kind of expected to take based on their sex (maybe not so much in real life, but in things like movies and TV shows), slash may make it easier for a woman to write about or imagine the characters in a relationship without using these roles.

label: Education & Reference
sentence:
Title: Inclusion for Special Education?
Question: Does anyone have any information on inclusion for special education students (websites, personal experiences, etc...)
Answer: Inclusion is when students with a need for individiualized instruction are included in the regular classroom and receive the services they need within the classroom setting.  This may be for some or all classes.

Students who are mainstreamed are most often students with mild to moderate learning or emotional disabilities.  They will have an invoiivualized education plan (IEP) written by a team of people concerned about his/her educational progress.  That team generally incudes special education teacher, regular education teachers, specialists such as speech therapists, parents and representatives from any community service providing agencies.

The IEP will include modifications and accomodations that may be made within the general education setting to allow the student to thrive.  These may be as simple as untimed tests and seating near the teacher, to having the teacher wear a special sound ampligfication device, among others.

Does inclusion work?  Well, that depends on the school district's commitment to inclduing kids in the regular classroom, on the students (and parents') willingness to meet some general classroom expectations, and upon the skill of the classroom teacher.  If everyone works together and expects success, it generally happens.  If any member of the instructional team doubts the child's ability to succedd, it usually becomes a self-fulfilling prohecy, and the child may end up back in a separate special education setting. This special environment is viewed as being a more restictive environment, whereas the incluusion class is viewed as a less restrictive environment, as required by the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (IDEA).

My third grader has surprised some naysayers and has been included in regular education for math and special subjects for two years now.  I also enjoy helping students reach their academic goals.

I hope this answers your question.

label: Science & Mathematics
sentence:
Question: im trying to find a g force scale that can tell me what happens to a human if it goes up .?
Answer: From wikipedia:\n\nOne often hears the term being applied to the limits that the human body can withstand without losing conciousness, sometimes referred to as "blacking out", or g-loc (loc stands for loss of consciousness). A typical person can handle about 5 g (50 m/s²) before this occurs, but through the combination of special g-suits and efforts to strain muscles —both of which act to force blood back into the brain— modern pilots can typically handle 9 g (90 m/s²) sustained (for a period of time) or more. Resistance to "negative" or upward gees which drive blood to the head, is much less. This limit is typically in the -2 to -3 g (-20 to -30 m/s²) range. The vision goes red and is also referred to as a "red-out". This is probably due to capillaries in the eyes bursting under the increased blood pressure. Humans can survive about 20 to 40 g instantaneously (for a very short period of time). Any exposure to around 100 g or more, even if momentary, is likely to be lethal.

label: Politics & Government
sentence:
Title: What is Spangdahlem Germany like?
Question: How is it to be statinoed there in the USAF?
Answer: As you know, I've also answered your question about Ramstein; so I'll give you more details for both here -- rather than writing out the same answer twice.

Bottom Line TRUTH: "What you get out of an overseas assignment is a direct measure of what you put into it -- period!"

There are a lot of people who sit around base all day long, and never do anything or go anywhere. If you ask them how they liked their assignment they'll tell you it was terrible because "There's nothing to do." But if you put in nothing, you get nothing -- it's that simple. Now, if you're willing to get out -- there's tons of things to do.

Spangdahlem is almost right on the border with Belgium. There are all sorts of places you can go for a day trip. You can go to Brussels, Amsterdam, Paris. All of these are a few hours away.
The city of Trier, nearby Spang, is the oldest city in Germany, and has old Roman ruins, and great shopping. 

Every base offers language courses to help you integrate. If you're willing to extend the effort, you can learn the language, and do even more. Also, Both Ramstein and Spang offer university courses with the University of Maryland where you can get your education through a Master's Degree.

You can go skiing in the Alps, and visit King Ludwig's castles (AWESOME). You can take tours offered by the base and visit anyplace in europe you want to go: Italy? England? Spain? You name it, there are tours.

Also, there's a company called "Ryanair" that flies out of a nearby commercial airport that offers super-cheap airfares (say -- twenty dollars -- round trip) to London, and to many other locales in Europe. Take advantage of it.

Both Ramstein and Spang have very active Officers' and Enlisted Spouce's organizations. If you want to be involved with base activities and meet new friends, you'll have all the opportunities you want.

You can travel, you can sightsee, you can shop, you can take classes, you can be involved with the community. You can be as involved and active as you wish. That's what I mean when I say, that what you get out of the experience is exactly what you put into it.

Any questions??

==============================================

Spangdahlem is in the Eifel Region of Germany. It's a very little town and a very big base. The closest towns nearby are Bitburg and Trier (the oldest city in Germany). Spang has a fairly high ops tempo, and it's a busy place to be. If you can make your question more specific, I'd be happy to give more details.

Question: system locksup (win xp)..using Dell Inspiron 8100?
Answer: I have fixed my lockup problem. What i did was first start the laptop in safe mode, then go to msconfig and uncheck most of the start up programs.  restart in safe mode again and run disk cleanup, defrag, sfc, and scandisk.  Restart and see if you can get on the internet and run windows update.  I had to try several times since it locked up during windows update.  If you are still locking up go to control panel system and advanced and performance and select the Adjust for best performance then apply and Ok and restart again.  Still locking up open event viewer and see if you have any red errors then post them here or if you have another pc look them up on the MS site.  I think the video card maybe the problem.  I also went to the dell site and downloaded the dell helper utility.  Hope this helps.\nHenry

Question: Why does a spoiled egg float in water?
Answer: As an egg gets older, it produces hydrogen sulfide, a gas. The gas moves to one end of the egg. To see how old an egg is, place it in a pan of water. If it floats, don't use it. If it stays on the bottom but points up, it is getting old, but I still use them. If it stays on the bottom, flat, it is fresh.

You can tell if an egg is hard-boiled by spinning it. If it spins easily and fast, it is hard boiled!

Hope this helps!

label: Politics & Government
sentence:
Title: Leaving Florida while on probation resulting from DUI?
Question: Now in Florida, got drunk driving, did some jail time, out on probation... Is it legal to leave the state of Florida permenatly while on probation.  Can terms of probation be transfered to another state?  Before I hear a bunch of "you shouldn't be driving drunk anyway" answers, please know that this is not my situation, it's my brother... and yes, he needs help..
Answer: Where does your brother want to move to, and why does he want to move to that place?  Does he have any job prospects in the different state, or does he have immediate family in that state?  (Immediate family would be parents, siblings, spouse, or children.)

If he has immediate family in the other state, there is a presumptive approval of the transfer of probation.  Your brother needs to speak to his probation officer about transferring, and has to fill out the paperwork.  He will have to pay a fee, which is currently $75, to the Interstate Compact of Florida and be up to date on all his costs and fees.

If he wants to move but doesn't have immediate family in the other state, he can apply for transfer of probation, but the receiving state has the right to turn down the transfer.

These rules are the same for all states.  I'm an Indiana Probation Officer, and have some clients who were able to transfer, and some who were denied transfer.

label: Computers & Internet
sentence:
Title: What's wrong with my yahoo messenger?
Question: Everytime I log on under my name it will not come up.  If I log in under my husbands name it opens and works great.  I've tried re-installing it, but it still is not working.  Any other ideas.  Thank you
Answer: First, I'd recommend uninstalling your Messenger and downloading and installing the newest verson from Yahoo!  When you do this, though, you might have a corrupt file in your Yahoo! Messenger directory. To fix the problem, you must manually delete the "Messenger" directory on your C: drive (default), then reinstall the Yahoo! Messenger application.

To delete the directory:
Close the Yahoo! Messenger application if you currently have it running. Make sure all instances of Internet Explorer are closed. 
Go to your desktop and double-click "My Computer." 
Click the "C:" drive. 
Go to:
C:\Program Files\Yahoo!
Highlight the Yahoo! Messenger folder and press the Delete key on your keyboard. (All archives will be deleted if they are not copied. Please see below.)

To install:
Close all running applications except for your Internet browser.
Visit the Yahoo! Messenger home page.
Click the "Download Now" button.

To copy your complete Message Archive:
Close Yahoo! Messenger (if it is currently running). 
Go to your Desktop and double-click "My Computer." 
Select the "C:" drive. 
Go to:
C:\Program Files\Yahoo!\Messenger\Profiles
Your "Profiles" folder contains your complete Message Archive. Copy it to the same location on another computer if you wish to view it elsewhere.

Note: If you copy this folder to another computer, your complete Message Archive will be copied, overriding the Message Archive on the computer to which you are copying.
-------------------------------------------------------------
After that, if you still have problems, make sure that you have the latest version of Macromedia's Flash Player installed, as Messenger uses certain Flash components on startup.  

Beyond that, your Yahoo! Messenger connection information may be incorrect. Follow these steps to configure your connection:
Click the "Messenger" menu in Yahoo! Messenger and select "Connection Preferences."
Enable the "Firewall with no proxies" option.
Select the correct Internet connection type and country from the pull-down menus.
Click the "OK" button at the bottom of the window.
Yahoo! Messenger will ask you if you want to sign in again with your new proxy settings. Click the "OK" button.
Enter your Yahoo! ID and password and click the "Sign In" button.

sentence:
Question: Why do elephants have tusks?
Answer: Elephants have evolved with tusks as the elongated teeth enable the elephants to manipulate and hold items with the trunk and tusks.  They can pick up quite small items and rotate in front of their lips using the trunk and tusk combination to strip off the leaves etc.  They also use the trunk to strip the bark off of trees,scrape earth up to dig water holes and mineral scrapes, and for defence - although their large size makes them fairly predator proof.\nIndian elephants have smaller tusks than African elephants because they have evolved as a jungle species and the bigger tusks would get in the way in the undergrowth etc, plus the lusher vegetation means they do not need to scrape for water etc.

Question: pedal. At the top of the hill the car's speed is 6m/s and at the bottom it is 20m/s. How much energy was cinverted into heat on the way down?
Answer: Total energy at the start is equal to the gravitonal potential energy plus the initial kinetic energy. That equals 320000j + 14400j. label: Science & Mathematics
sentence:
Title: what causes a rainbow?
Question: I have really havn'tt seen one in a long time, and is it common that it happens after a rain fall?
Answer: The rainbow effect can be observed whenever there are water drops in the air and sunlight shining from behind the observer at a low altitude or angle. The most spectacular rainbow displays when half of the sky is still dark with draining clouds and the observer is at a spot with clear sky overhead. The rainbow effect is also commonly seen near waterfalls or fountains. Rainbow fringes can sometimes be seen at the edges of backlit clouds and as vertical bands in distant rain or virga. The effect can also be artificially created by dispersing water droplets into the air during a sunny day.

Question: Well my sister works and so does my mama and when my sister gets paid she gives my mama money to help out and since my sister has been working she hasnt purchased anything for herself and she just got paid and she wants a cell phone and thats the only thing she really wants to get for herself but the only problem is my mama does not want my sister to spend alot of money on a cell phone and my sister is at work and she thinks she is going to get one but she does not know my mama is going to tell her she cant get one and then when she gets off of work and my mama tells her no then my sister is going to be mad and she will not want to be here anymore and if she leaves I will be sad and I would miss her so If you can please tell me what to do or who is not being fair or how you think everything should work out? pleaseeee and sorry this soooooo long
Answer: Would it be possible for your sister to set aside a little money from each paycheck.  Enough for her to save with but not enough for your MaMa to notice.  If she can I'd tell her to save for the cell phone and then to keep saving so she has a nest egg.  I hope it all works out for you.

label: Science & Mathematics
sentence:
Title: How do I begin to solve for n if Pn,4 = 56Pn,2 ?
Question: I can get this far n!/(n-4)! = 56 [n!/(n-2)!] 

then I am stuck.

thank you
Answer: so far, so good

n!/(n-4)! = 56 [n!/(n-2)!] 

multiply both sides by (n-2)!/n!

[n!(n-2)!] / [n!(n-4)!] = 56

(n-2)! / (n-4)! = 56

(n-2)(n-3) = 56

You could multiply this out and solve the quadratic, in which case you will get one positive and one negative root, or if you remember that 56 = 8*7, then that quickly leads to n = 10

label: Health
sentence:
Question: my step daughter has scabies, I  was wondering if animals can catch it?
Answer: This is what I found on the site listed below:

"Pets become infested with a different kind of scabies mite. If your pet is infested with scabies, (also called mange) and they have close contact with you, the mite can get under your skin and cause itching and skin irritation. However, the mite dies in a couple of days and does not reproduce. The mites may cause you to itch for several days, but you do not need to be treated with special medication to kill the mites. Until your pet is successfully treated, mites can continue to burrow into your skin and cause you to have symptoms."

So the answer to your question is yes they can have scabies, but a different type.

Title: Should Women have authority over a Man?
Question: ! Timothy 2;12, I do not permit a Woman to teach or to have authority over a Man; she must be silent.
Answer: The testimonies of manhood and womenhood are often neglected by todays so called "church". Rarely do men know that males are supposed to be a living testimony of Christ. Just as rarely do women know that females are to be a living testimony of the redeemed Church of Christ. Such truth is portrayed in the indisputable writings of the Apostle Paul in Ephesians:

Ephesians 5:
21 Submitting yourselves one to another in the fear of God.
22 Wives, submit yourselves unto your own husbands, as unto the Lord.
23 For the husband is the head of the wife, even as Christ is the head of the church: and he is the saviour of the body.
24 Therefore as the church is subject unto Christ, so let the wives be to their own husbands in every thing.
25 Husbands, love your wives, even as Christ also loved the church, and gave himself for it;
26 That he might sanctify and cleanse it with the washing of water by the word,
27 That he might present it to himself a glorious church, not having spot, or wrinkle, or any such thing; but that it should be holy and without blemish.
28 So ought men to love their wives as their own bodies. He that loveth his wife loveth himself.
29 For no man ever yet hated his own flesh; but nourisheth and cherisheth it, even as the Lord the church:
30 For we are members of his body, of his flesh, and of his bones.

Verse 21 bluntly clearifies that we are to care for each other, and submit to the needs of one another. Paul further explains that the relationship of husband and wife is the same as that of Christ and His Church. Therefore, let the man love and take care of his wife as Christ does the Church, and let the wife honour and obey her husband as the Church does Christ.

This is an often neglected topic in today's modern teaching, because it isn't politically correct. However, Christ nor His Apostles were politically correct.  As Peter states:

ACTS 5:29 Then Peter and the [other] apostles answered and said, We ought to obey God rather than men.

Politics, including feminism and political correctness have no place in the Church of Christ. No Apostle or early heads of the Church ever tried to update Christ's doctrine to the standards of Society. Think about it, you fools, if sinners are to define holiness, then who isn't holy? If sinners are to define sin, then who needs the sacrifice of Christ?

And for those who think that Christians cannot correct, judge, or rebuke, why does the Spirit of Christ through Paul say otherwise?

2TIMOTHY 3:16 All scripture [is] given by inspiration of God, and [is] profitable for doctrine, for reproof, for correction, for instruction in righteousness:

label: Business & Finance
sentence:
Question: How do you convience your parents into letting you switch schools?
Answer: Although I feel for your situation, please understand, not all schools will allow you to just switch.  There are many more details to consider. Like tuition affordability, the ranking of the new desired schools educational records of success, and the convieniece of transporting you to and from the new school just to mention a few.

My children had to switch schools once, and they hated it, they wanted to move back to their old school, but a few years later they are adjusted and happy where they are.

If you are feeling badly at your current school due to harrasment by other students, stand up for yourself, speak with your principal, councelor, or call the state hotline of you are being physically threatened, they will investigate.

Talk to your parents about what makes this school so bad, and try to resolve your issues, they may see your point if you address it in a responsible and mature way.

Title: i was promoted as a supervisor of a retail company but i was transferd to another location, what will i do 1st
Question: the shop is in a bad shape profit-wise and has big shrinkage, what can you advise me to do as my first move or what plan shal i apply?
Answer: i think you should have a meeting with the manager. ask lots of questions. find out all about that location. find out about how they run things and who they have in charge during each open day.
then have a meeting with all the staff. ask them questions on how things are going at work. whats okay and whats not. ask them what they like and dont like about working there.
make sure the wright people are working in the wright department. there could be cashiers who are not so great at math and they could be the ones loosing money. or, some of the employees could be placed in departments they dont like and becus of that they wont work well in that area.
you should observe for a couple of weeks and see how things go and then take things in yur hands and start to make changes for the best.
good luck.

label: Sports
sentence:
Title: Why do so many martial artists have such a low opinion of Tae Kwon Do?
Question: Tae Kwon Do gets and unnecessarily bad rap. Traditional Tae Kwon Do (the original unwatered down non-sport  version of the art) is an excellent form or self defense. I train in it now. I would put it up against boxing any day of the week!
Answer: Probably because most other forms or Karate in my opinion and many others are more formidable... and more of a true form than Tae.

Tae is a great form of fitness and has a bunch of impressive kicks... but in a true fight (although Karate isn't about fighting) Tae isn't going to get you very far.

But as a workout it's great... and it's certainly a discipline.

But compared to a lot of other forms it's lacking in style.
